groups_present.name: wheel
groups_present.description: The unix wheel group. Members of this group can do anything.

groups_present.name: Developers
groups_present.description: Can modify anything, but cannot modify persistent configuration.

groups_present.name: Deployers
groups_present.description: Like a Maintainer, but with permission to modify persistent configuration constrained to resources that are considered to be 'application resources'. A deployment is an application resource. The messaging server is not. Items like datasources and JMS destinations are not considered to be application resources by default, but this is configurable.

groups_present.name: Operators
groups_present.description: Monitor permissions, plus can modify runtime state, but cannot modify anything that ends up in the persistent configuration. Could, for example, restart a server.

groups_present.name: Maintainers
groups_present.description: Operator permissions, plus can modify the persistent configuration.

groups_present.name: Monitors
groups_present.description: A read-only role. Cannot modify any resource.

groups_present.name: Auditors
groups_present.description: Can read everything, but cannot modify anything.

groups_present.name: Administrators
groups_present.description: Full access to everything. Can modify anything, including persistent configuration.

groups_present.name: Users
groups_present.description: Can read and modify their own resources, but cannot modify anything else.

groups_present.name: Guests
groups_present.description: Can read everything, but cannot modify anything.

groups_present.name: SuperUsers
groups_present.description: Can do anything, including modifying persistent configuration.
